title: Helix by Reininger 2013 Phinny Hill Vineyard Syrah (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: This wine comes from a vineyard best known for its Cabernet Sauvignon. Perfumed flower, smoke, herb and purple fruit aromas lead to fresh, elegant fruit and herb flavors. It intrigues.

title: I Capitani 2017 Serum  (Greco di Tufo)
description: This has a rather subdued nose offering hints of wild flower and citrus. On the palate, bright acidity underscores yellow apple, lemon zest and a hint of green melon while a suggestion of white almond adds interest before the quick finish.

title: Junta 2016 Grand Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Curicó Valley)
description: This wine's cherry and oak-derived clove aromas lead to a lively palate with abrasive tannins. Its medicinal black fruit flavors turn darker, drier and toastier on the finish.

title: Kiona 2015 Heart of the Hill Vineyard Malbec (Red Mountain)
description: Exotic spice and dried fruit aromas are followed by plump, ripe fruit flavors in this wine. It's enjoyable but seems a bit evolved for its age.

title: La Castellina 2013 Tommaso Bojola  (Chianti Classico)
description: This opens with subtle aromas of black currant and caramel. The ripe forward palate delivers black plum, vanilla and black pepper alongside supple tannins.

title: Las Palmeras 2015 Chardonnay (Monterey County)
description: Candied lemon and a sour citrus pith blend the sweet and tangy sensations on the nose of this simple yet clean wine. Smoke flavors lead off the sip, followed by lemon butter and a touch of midpalate sweetness.

title: Luscatel NV Damat Semi-Seco Sparkling (Cava)
description: Semisweet Cavas have limited appeal, but this one hits the spot. Its briny citrus aromas come with a sweet tropical element. Slight stickiness adds weight to the palate, which offers mixed tropical fruit and green banana flavors. Lime, mango, pineapple and papaya notes all add to the sugary fruit salad that this is.

title: Maryhill 2014 McKinley Springs Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: This wine's appealing aromas include black currant, herb, clove and woodspice. The fruit flavors are tart and lively, but the tannins are gritty and distracting.

title: Mont Gravet 2017 Colombard (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: This fruity, cool-climate wine is lively with acidity and bright citrus flavors. Crisp and zingy, it's totally ready to drink for the summer.

title: Monte Branco 2016 Alento Red (Alentejano)
description: This is a ripe, fruity wine. With its soft tannins and juicy blackberries, it is open and rich. It offers the warmth that comes from the Alentejo sun while keeping a crisp edge of acidity. Drink now.

title: Oveja Negra 2015 Single Vineyard Carmenère (Maule Valley)
description: This Carmenère's saturated nose deals baked plum, spice and animal hide aromas. It's chunky and obtuse on the palate, with tartaric edginess and stewed, spicy berry flavors. It holds steady on the finish.

title: Parras Wines 2016 Mula Velha Reserva Red (Lisboa)
description: A broad wine, young at heart and full of fruit, this is jammy, ripe and made to drink young. Blackberry fruit gives an almost sweet character to the wine, with soft texture and smooth aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Penny's Hill 2015 Cracking Black Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
description: Hence the name, this inky-hued wine is packed with rich blackberry fruit, mocha and black licorice. The palate feels a little hot and displays more rich, chocolatey flavors, with grainy but soft tannins keeping a round feel.

title: Quinta da Alorna 2015 Portal da Aguia Red (Tejo)
description: This wine with its blend of Touriga Nacional, Castelão and Trincadeira (a change from the previous vintage) is rich and has some fine tannins. It is a great value with its ripe berry fruit, generous texture and final acidity. Drink now.

title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2017 Lagoalva Tahão 1 White (Tejo)
description: Five grapes go into this satisfying blend. It is soft, juicy and still developing. Citrus acidity meets warmer white fruits in this balanced wine. Drink from late 2018.

title: Quinta da Mariposa 2014 Mariposa Tinto Red (Dão)
description: This smooth, ripe, open wine is all about the red fruits and acidity. It is softly textured, juicy with berry flavors and with a delicious fresh aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Rubino Estates Winery 2014 Riserva Collection Sangiovese (Livermore Valley)
description: This wine has an alluring oak aroma, rich, spicy and oaky flavors and a mouth-filling texture due to full body and pretty strong tannins. The woody notes of cedar, tobacco, chocolate and cinnamon take center stage while fruit flavors play a secondary role.

title: Salvestrin 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Tobacco, leather and cassis work well to present a united front of flavor in this full-bodied richly woven wine. Herbal and woody, with pronounced tannin, it finishes in cedar and pencil.

title: Schlink Haus 2016 Riesling (Landwein Rhein)
description: A delicate veil of sugar lends sweetness to this juicy fruity Riesling. The palate boasts straightforward but lip-smacking white-peach and lemon flavors off set by sunny acidity. Drink now through 2020.

title: Settlers Rise 2016 White (South Eastern Australia)
description: Attractive pear, apple, peach and guava notes are backed by a wet stone quality on the nose. The mouthfeel is tight and refreshing, with a medium body and a long, fruity mouthwatering finish.

title: Tenuta Cavalier Pepe 2016 Bianco di Bellona Coda di Volpe (Irpinia)
description: Linear and bright, this has delicate aromas of pineapple and yellow stone fruit that follow over to the palate. Fresh acidity gives it a clean finish.

title: Valdivieso 2016 Valley Selection Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)
description: This wine's intense nose smells oily, as though starting to break down. Its lean palate deals standard Chilean Sauvignon Blanc flavors of citrus and green herbs but also latent bitterness. Peppery bitterness remains on the finish.

title: Veramonte 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)
description: This wine's earthy berry aromas lead to a solid palate full of tannins. Its herbal plum and berry flavors are typical of Chilean Cabernet, finishing spicy, peppery and firm.

title: Adega Mãe 2016 Copo 3 Branco White (Lisboa)
description: Full of apricot and pineapple, this is a ripe, full-bodied wine. It has great acidity as well as fruitiness, giving a wine that is refreshing, with an almond character and a final zing of freshness. Drink now.

title: Agate Ridge 2016 Pinot Gris (Southern Oregon)
description: Nothing stands out here, but it's a perfectly sound and drinkable wine, with round, clean fruity flavors. Apple and pear notes come together, with a touch of pineapple and citrus zest.

title: Agricola Bellaria 2016 Falanghina (Irpinia)
description: Aromas of Spanish broom and yellow stone fruit lift out of the glass. The bright straightforward palate offers yellow pear, and a hint of lime alongside fresh acidity.

title: Alois 2016 Caulino Falanghina (Campania)
description: Delicate scents of yellow spring flower and yellow peach lift out of the glass. The rounded, rather mature palate offers dried apricot and tangy lemon zest alongside a hint of bitter almond.

title: Antica Masseria del Sigillo 2016 Sigillo Apio Fiano (Campania)
description: The shy nose eventually reveals whiffs of spring flower and white stone fruit. On the palate, fresh acidity brightens pineapple, grapefruit and a hint of bitter almond.

title: Arnaud Baillot 2016  Bourgogne
description: This bright, crisp wine is tangy and full of refreshing fruit. Young and bright, it is touched by minerality and ready to drink.

title: Barefoot NV Pinot Noir (California)
description: Light but flavorful and fresh, this wine has good varietal character, medium body and good complexity, too. Aromas of red cherry and tea lead to cherry and plum flavors, mild tannins and a bit of fresh acidity for balance.
